explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a multimodal deep learning model for predicting Bitcoin price movements, which is a machine learning application.
explanations.supervised learning: The model is trained on labeled data (tweets and price data) to predict extreme price movements, which is a supervised learning task.
explanations.classification: The task involves predicting extreme price movements, which can be framed as a classification problem (e.g., predicting whether a price movement will be extreme or not).
explanations.support vector machine: The hybrid model includes an SVM component based on price data.
explanations.SVM: The hybrid model includes an SVM component based on price data.
explanations.neural network: The model includes a text-based Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), which is a type of neural network.
explanations.deep learning: The proposed model is a multimodal deep learning model, indicating the use of deep learning techniques.
explanations.representation learning: The model uses FinBERT embeddings to represent tweets, which is a form of representation learning.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The text-based component of the model is a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN).
explanations.CNN: The text-based component of the model is a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN).
